image.altText: A politician stands behind microphones and speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The NT chief minister says she is "more than happy" to face any potential challenges to the legality of the Alice Springs youth curfew and wishes "good luck" to anyone who brings one.

title.children: 'Bring it on': Chief minister welcomes potential legal challenges to Alice Springs curfew

image.altText: Armani Francois

props.synopsis: The day-to-day lives of children in Alice Springs are being impacted by the town's youth curfew, on the brink of school holidays.

title.children: Armani was stopped by police during curfew while getting a burrito. She says it was 'intimidating'

image.altText: Indigenous woman sits on the ground and paints

props.synopsis: Renowned Yolŋu artist Naminapu Maymuru-White has been invited to exhibit at one of the world’s most prestigious international arts events, the Venice Biennale.

title.children: Yolŋu artist who paints the stars headed for bright lights of northern hemisphere

image.altText: A blue-tinted swimming pool on an apartment hotel rooftop.

props.synopsis: Bystanders performed CPR on the men, who got into trouble trying to help a two-year-old who had fallen into the Surfers Paradise pool, but paramedics say the pair died at the scene.

title.children: 'Extremely emotional scene' as father, grandfather drown trying to save 2yo in hotel pool

image.altText: An illustration depicting vials of red liquid, a man walking with a duffel bag and sheets of paper flying through the air.

props.synopsis: Vials of replica weight loss drugs Ozempic and Mounjaro are being illegally shipped across the world from a house on the outskirts of Sydney.

title.children: Red vials of replica Ozempic are being posted all around the world. The trail leads back to Australia

image.altText: Richard Scolyer

props.synopsis: Professor Richard Scolyer took courageous steps as a cancer researcher, becoming a guinea pig for a radical experiment. And the results could spell the biggest breakthrough in 20 years.

title.children: World-first clinical trials soon to start after 'fantastic' results for Richard Scolyer

image.altText: A man standing near his unfinished home

props.synopsis: Steve Yates is just one of many aspiring home owners who have been left in limbo as Victoria's insurance authority deals with a backlog of collapsed builders.

title.children: As Steve visits the site where his family home is meant to sit, his stomach sinks

image.altText: A mother standing outside a home holding her baby and next to her young son

props.synopsis: Government Services Minister Bill Shorten says 3,000 new Service Australia workers will help sort the backlog of claims and relieve long call wait-times, as benefit recipients say the system is too complex and slow.

title.children: Why educated, affluent Australians are unable to navigate the welfare system

image.altText: boy in cap with small girl

props.synopsis: A mourning family leans on the community after an Easter holiday outing ends in the tragic death of their teenage son.

title.children: Family 'struggling' following tragic death of 17-year-old at Hastings Point bridge

image.altText: Police officers put a person into the back of a divisional van, viewed from helicopter footage.

props.synopsis: Police say three teenagers suspected of conducting home invasions while armed with machetes have been arrested after a high-speed car chase through Melbourne's north-western suburbs.

title.children: Police believe teenagers carried out home invasions armed with machetes before 200 kph car chase in Melbourne

image.altText: A teenager with shirt off throws a punch with gloves on, and hits pads held by another teenager with shirt on

props.synopsis: The declaration of a two-week youth curfew in Alice Springs to curb crime and antisocial behaviour has been called a "circuit-breaker" by some and a "punitive" response by others. But one thing almost everyone agrees on is the need for medium and long-term solutions to tackle the town's issues.

title.children: Calls for long-term solutions in Alice Springs after two-week youth curfew ends

image.altText: Joan Baez smiles at the bottom of the stairs at a government building, a large line of police stands at the top.

props.synopsis: The revered folk singer's documentary reveals her toughest relationships and the internal battle she has waged constantly since childhood.

title.children: On the surface, Joan Baez was an icon. Beneath it all, she was living an unbearable struggle

image.altText: A man tries to log in to myGov on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: The Digital ID bill will establish a voluntary identity verification service, building on the existing myGovID which is already used by 10.5 million Australians to access government services.

title.children: Would you use a government-issued ID to prove your identity online? You may soon have the option

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks player Lloyd Meek handpasses in the tackle of two Gelong Cats in the rain.

props.synopsis: A packed MCG will host the traditional Easter Monday clash between Hawthorn and Geelong, as Cats champion Tom Hawkins celebrates his 350th game. Follow live.

title.children: Cats and Hawks forced off the field by threat of lightning at MCG

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The game has been stopped for lightning
3QT: Geelong make a stand and lead again by 36 points
Richmond's Liam Baker offered one-match ban

image.altText: Peter Bol runs through rain at the Stawell Gift races.

props.synopsis: The men and women's finals of the running race are put on hold following a major storm, amid severe weather warnings in the west of the state and damage to power lines.

title.children: Stawell Gift delayed by torrential downpour as almost 12,000 left without power across Victoria

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin chairs a meeting with members of the government

props.synopsis: One of Vladimir Putin's fiercest critics calls on Australia and other Western nations to declare his leadership illegitimate following a Russian presidential election that was widely considered a sham.

title.children: One thing the West can do to make Putin's backers listen

image.altText: a crane with two men working saw into the bridge

props.synopsis: 22 crew members of the ship that collapsed the Baltimore bridge reman on board and crews work to clear debris.

title.children: Crews clear first pieces of Baltimore bridge as ship remains motionless

image.altText: Two basketball fans cheering.

props.synopsis: The Tasmania JackJumpers have touched down in Hobart after securing their maiden NBL championship title in Melbourne on Sunday night, winning the final game 83-81.

title.children: JackJumpers treated to heroes' welcome following maiden NBL championship victory

image.altText: A little penguin at the zoo.

props.synopsis: Climate change can feel "bigger than just one person … but individuals can do something about this," a CSIRO researcher says.

title.children: New study shows dog attacks threaten to wipe out entire penguin colonies within just a few years

image.altText: A young man with dark hair, a beard, a suit and glasses walks on the street.

props.synopsis: Network Ten applies for a last-minute application to introduce new evidence in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against the company and its journalist Lisa Wilkinson, just days before the judgement was due to be handed down.

title.children: Network Ten makes eleventh-hour application to introduce new evidence in Bruce Lehrmann defamation case

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

props.synopsis: When the RSV Nuyina was first launched in 2021, the vessel was described as a "Disneyland for scientists". But, three years, and several PR disasters, later, the $528 million ship is yet to undertake a dedicated science voyage.

title.children: Australian Antarctic Division 'struggling' to use $528 million icebreaker for dedicated science voyages

image.altText: A drone image of a street filled with tens of thousands of protesters in front of the Israeli parliament at night time

props.synopsis: The protesters called for early elections and a ceasefire to return the remaining hostages held by Hamas in Gaza, in what are reported to be Israel's largest demonstrations since the beginning of the war.

title.children: Tens of thousands of Israelis rally against Netanyahu, call for ceasefire

image.altText: Ambulance rushing along a road with lights on

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old man has been charged after an SUV struck and killed a woman on Queensland's Fraser Coast.

title.children: Easter tragedy as nurse dies in collision with allegedly stolen, speeding SUV

image.altText: A camera overlooks a moody grey sky.

props.synopsis: The United States will impose new visa restrictions on a number of Hong Kong officials over the crackdown on rights and freedoms in the Chinese-ruled territory.

title.children: US imposes visa restrictions on Hong Kong officials in response to tough security law

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers stands in a corridor holding a coffee cup in dark early morning light

props.synopsis: If the Fair Work Commission delivers a minimum wage rise at or above inflation, how would it change the RBA's decision about when or whether to cut interest rates?

title.children: The government is barracking for wage rises and rate cuts. Can it have both? The budget will offer a clue

image.altText: Boxer Tim Tszyu defends himself from the punches of Sebastian Fundora.

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu's team is rejigging the timeline for the Australian boxing sensation after an an accidental elbow from Sebastian Fundora left him blind in one eye for almost their entire fight.

title.children: 'Bloodbath it was': Tim Tszyu's plans for boxing world domination on hold after rogue elbow scuppers Vegas fight

image.altText: reproductive-health-supplies-coalition-4aerIHVyBBE-unsplash

props.synopsis: The government will pay for the most widely used contraceptive methods for the nine million Canadian women of reproductive age as the first part of a major healthcare reform.

title.children: Canadian women to get free contraception as part of health care reform

image.altText: A hazy sky envelops Perth's metro area from a high vantage point

props.synopsis: Perth has just endured its driest six-month spell since records began almost 150 years ago, with less than 22 millimetres of rain to the end of March. What does this mean for our precious water resources?

title.children: Perth has been enjoying a glorious stretch of weather, but experts warn the cloudless skies could come at a cost

image.altText: Feijoas are native to South America and popular in New Zealand

props.synopsis: Feijoa trees are hardy, fruitful, fragrant, and thrive in both heat and frost. So why do they not enjoy the same cult following in Australia as they do in New Zealand?

title.children: Feijoas are 'theoretically the perfect fruit', so why don't we love them more?

image.altText: two men talk to each other on a dusty unused block.

props.synopsis: The Shire of Halls Creek is accused of breaching fair processes during a probe into alleged misconduct by its former chief executive, as cracks emerge in its relationship with an Indigenous group charged with helping to reduce youth crime in the region.

title.children: Sacked CEO accuses outback WA council of running 'kangaroo court'

image.altText: King Charles shakes a woman's hand while walking next to Queen Camilla.

props.synopsis: King Charles makes his first public appearance since announcing his cancer diagnosis alongside Queen Camilla on Easter Sunday.

title.children: 'He is looking very well': King Charles makes first public appearance since announcing cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A woman stands staring at the camera with her father in a recliner behind her and a walker in front of him.

props.synopsis: There is $64,000 sitting in William Baker's Home Care Package account, but his full-time carer and daughter can't get the one thing she believes would give her disabled bipolar dad quality of life — a side by side ATV.

title.children: A daughter's desperate plea for rural funding rethink to help dad get out and about

image.altText: An intersection with a give way sign

props.synopsis: Police say a 62-year-old man and a 54-year-old woman from the Mount Gambier suburb of Suttontown have died in a three-car crash in South Australia's south-east.

title.children: Couple killed in three-car crash on SA highway

image.altText: Shelby McMahon

props.synopsis: A goalkeeping blunder, a rising teen, and a goal of the year contender combine to see Melbourne City leapfrog Sydney FC to the Premier's Plate in the A-League Women.

title.children: Goal of the year contender and 15-year-old rising star combine to hand City the Premier's Plate in dramatic day of play
